FuncDef:
The value-added-service quota-out command configures whether the system allows a value added service user to keep online when the applied quota is used up and the response packet from the AAA accounting server carries no quota information.
The undo value-added-service quota-out command restores the default configuration.
By default, the system allows a value added service user to keep online.

ParaDef.Info:
The link of diameter is down.
-

Allows a BOD/DAA user to keep online after the quota is used up.
-

Forces a BOD/DAA user to go offline after the quota is used up.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the value-added-service quota-out online command is configured, the service keeps running and accounting is performed after the quota is used up.
If the value-added-service quota-out diameter-link-down online command is run, the quota is used up, and the Diameter link is disconnected, accounting is still performed for services, and traffic is not interrupted.
If the value-added-service quota-out diameter-link-down offline command is run, the quota is used up, and the Diameter link is disconnected, the value-added services users go offline .
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
This command applies to charged BOD and DAA services .
If the value-added-service quota-out offline command is configured, for a DAA service with non-uniform accounting, the service bandwidth is set to 0 and traffic cannot be forwarded after the quota is exhausted, but the service is not deleted; for a DAA service with uniform accounting and for a BOD service, the service with the bandwidth set to 0 is not displayed after the quota is exhausted. When you run the display value-added-service user user-id command to check information about the value-added services of the user, the service number is displayed in disaccord with the information of the service ID table.
